text: This is a quick in and out spot if you are craving a hamburger or hotdog with some good coney sauce! They give you a TON of fries so you only need to order a small. They have a good milkshake menu if you are wanting to top your meal off with something sweet!! There is outdoor seating otherwise it's grab and go at this location .

Tried to go here at 11:40 tonight for a quick hot dog to-go. Knowing they close at 11, and all their signs saying they closed at 11, we were shocked to find they wouldn't not serve us. Very disappointed.

Small little hot dog place that was surprisingly delicious. Found it randomly walking to the Pride Parade in Chicago and thought it'd be a good idea to get something small to eat before we go. There's a nice little outdoor seating area and we were served fairly fast. The dogs were packed with condiments, which was awesome, and definitely want to come back!
FEED. ME. DEVIL DAWGS. Shake Shack who? Ew. Devil Dawgs is legit chicago grub. So tasty. Get  bag of fries & a shake too. Crazy good.

The last few times I've been here, the place wasn't open at 10:30. It was either at 11 or after 11. I asked the cashier what do they open, he said "we open at 10:30 but we just got a lot of things to do". Then you should really switch the opening time to 11, instead of being unprepared and telling numerous people that you're not open yet while we are over here thinking you open at 10:30. Who is running this place?

I used to live down the street from this place and would eat here all the time.  It's been several years since I've been back and my boyfriend and I were craving polish sausage after our long flight back home.  Came here on a whim because I remembered they had some of the best polish in the city, imo.  Huge mistake.  They gave us two brats instead of two polish.  We're not ones to turn down good food.  Oh well, we ate them but they were very underwhelming.  Furthermore, we paid for a bucket of fries that was half filled and soggy.  I always remember their fries being on the extra crispy side which is what I love!  Not even close.  To top it off the bun on our Chicago style hot dog was so wet it was practically inconsumable.  I actually had to eat a hot dog with half a bun because the other half was gummy and soaked.  It completely fell apart.  Wonder if these guys changed owners, regardless it's a shame.  I used to love this joint.  Needless to say, we'll never be back.
This late night spot has everything! Funny workers, fast service, and tons of options. My slaw dog really hit the spot. The small fry was actually very large. I'd go back...

Heard about devils dawgs before so I thought I'd give it a try. My first impression was that I thought it would be like any other fast food place. I was wrong! The burger I ordered was outstandingly tasty. Small, but sooo worth it! The place was small by itself however, fast service and great staff. Definitely will be coming back here and recommend to others.  Came back and omg. Again I am so pleased with the service, the burger, and this whole place! I got the kick ass burger this time and it was so tasty. I can't stress enough how affordable and good this place is.

Cheap! Quick! Delicious!! This place seriously exceeded my expectations! I heard good things so I decided to give it a try. I was reluctant at first, because it's winter and this is a "shack" type establishment, the only sitting area is outside. But I decided to go and eat it elsewhere.  First off, the prices rock. You can get a burger for $2.40!! The fry and drink combo is only $2.99 and it's a fairly large drink & decent amount of fries. For a college student like myself and others in the Lincoln Park area that is usually an important factor!   The fries are the greasy "fast food" shack type that you somehow don't regret eating... However they are not TOO greasy or too salty, which is a plus. You can also get them in a bucket! The buckets are the bomb and can be made with a variety of different sauces.  The "dawgs" are the bomb and they have a variety of those as well, with cool names and toppings. The  Blue Demon's Dawg (represent!) for instance, comes with devil sauce, onion, sauerkraut, pickle, spicy mustard- my friends like that one.  You can get a Chicago style burger!  Parking sucks if you are driving and it would probably be a lot easier to eat in the outdoor area during the summer but other than that the place rocks!  The burgers are on the small side, but they are really cheap and soooo good so I think they are worth it. If you normally eat a whole/large burger I'd recommend getting 2! You'll probably want another anyway....

Stopped here after a tour of DePaul University.  Burgers are surprisingly small, but good. For such a small place,there is a good variety of dogs, burgers and sausages. Shakes were good, plenty of flavor options.

I can't speak for the meat but absolutely will return for the milkshakes. They offer lots of fun flavor, even some as funky as green tea. As a purist, I ordered the chocolate peanut butter. I watched (drooled) as the the worker behind the counter blended vanilla soft serve, a heaping scoop of peanut butter, and chocolate syrup together and topped it with a big dollop of whipped cream. Heaven.  It's a big shake, so I might recommend sharing if you're trying to avoid the subsequent stomach ache from excess consumption of sugar and dairy.

Visited on a blustery night when we were craving some not-good-for-you food. Counter service with no indoor seating. Ended up eating it in our car with the heat on. Yay winter! Here's what we got: -Fries. Pretty good but could have been left in a little longer to get them a little crispier. Great taste and the "bag" was plentiful. Enough for two people. 4/5 -Chicago style dog. While good, not outstanding. I love a good Chicago dog, but I've had better in the city. The ingredients slopped off very easily and just wasn't as tasty as other ones. The dog itself had a good snap and was tasty. Next time I'll avoid the Chicago style and try a coney or something else. 3.5/5  -Chocolate shake. Huge and delicious. 4.5/5 -Burger. OMG. We got two single burgers. These things are amazing. Just a simple cheeseburger with ketchup, mayo, and onions. They are small, sure, but one of the best fast food-esque burgers I've had. Get a double, triple, or even a couple singles if you're really hungry. I see myself returning just for this burger in the near future! All in all, this place rocks. It's pretty inexpensive (small fry, shake, dog, two burgers ~$17) and so tasty. Go if you're craving this kind of food!
First time in Chicago and I wanted to try a Chicago Dog! This was the perfect place. Exactly what you would expect in a hole in the wall- grab and go- joint.
I got the veggie burger on a pretzel bun and it was so delicious!! a lot of places can't make tasty veggie burgers but they sure nailed it! :)

The hot dogs are average to good.  Snappy hot dog skin... good...  soft steamed bun...  good....  Coney Island chili sauce is sweet... not good.    I'm kind of a coney chili snob and can saw that this is slightly better than opening a can chili.   The place is a grease pit, which is fine, has only outdoor seating and is limited.    The fries were bits and pieces mostly and over salted.    There are better hot dog places around... and at $4 a hot dog this place should have been better.

I was going to get a hot dog, but saw pics of their burgers and they looked yummy. So I got a double patty burger since they looked a little small...very yummy with cheese oozing out! They give you a TON of fries (one order) too which was enough to fill me and my BF! But, if you eat a lot...you may want to get 2 burgers since they run kinda small.  Prices are reasonable too, they could easily up charge their food because of the location. Glad they keep it real though! You got struggling college students nearby and my former h.s. (Lincoln Park) that need cheap bites!
There a 90% chance that you're high and/or drunk when you're here. Get a chocolate peanut butter milkshake to dip your fries in. You're welcome.

This place has been great for a nice side of fries and hot dog. I have only have had the burger a few times but other friends and I think it's pretty good! My concern: sometimes unpredictable, service and food may be good one day but the next day not so much.

Great place near DePaul if you're craving a hot dog or burgers (more for the hot dogs).  It's a really small place, so you'll probably have to take-out, unless the weather is nice and you sit outside their 2 table picnic area.  Lost a star for price.

For the most part i haven't had the worst experience with Devil  Dawgs because their food is absolutely delicious. But...lately their service has been completely terrible. I have been on hold for 10 minutes before hanging up twice on two separate occasions. Aside from the fact that when I walked in this last time, the lady was sitting there chopping up onions with absolutely no customers in front of her. My most recent visit I got a completely different burger than what I ordered and when i went back had only one of my two burgers corrected and told they are out of lettuce after i already paid for it and not offered a refund. Anyways, all in all their food is delicious but who wants to go through all that trouble and unprofessionalism for a burger and fries. There is definitely better burger places in Lincoln Park.

We tracked this place down after online recommendations and it didn't disappoint. I tried the "Elvis" burger with bacon, peanut butter and siracha, and though I was kinda let down by its small size, it was so really tasty. Combined with a ton of fries drenched in their devil sauce and a malt shake (which must have been like 1500 calories), I rolled homeward with a smile on my face.  If I had known the sizes on beforehand I probably either would've ordered several burgers or tried my luck at one of their hotdogs. The staff was friendly and helpful even when I wanted to swap a shirt for a hat (yes, they do sell merch!). If I'm in Chicago again I'll definitely come back!

An employee here was extremely rude to myself and a group of friends I was with.  We arrived around 10:54pm, to find out they were already closed.  We asked when they are supposed to close and the employee responded back with 11pm.  We said "it's 10:54pm" and the employee responded back with "Do you really want to go there with me bro!?" And walked away.  No matter how good their hot dawgs are, they will never get my business again.  He could have handle it much nicer and just stated that it was a slow night and they made the decision to close up earlier.  Unfortunately the employee's companies hire, are a reflection on the company itself.  Fire fast, higher slow!

While I have frequented Devil Dawgs many a time, and am generally very pleased by the quick and delicious food.  I have to say this past Saturday 6/25 was quite the opposite experience. A group of friends maybe 6 or 7 of us, walked over to Devil Dawgs, and arrived there at approximately 10:54, I understand they close at 11pm on Saturday, however when we arrived, we discovered they had already closed. We approached an employee/manager?  who was outside and asked if they were indeed closed as it wasn't quite 11 yet, and we had a few minutes to order. He replied rather unpleasantly "Do you really wanna go there with me bro?" Instead of saying it was a slow night, I'm sorry we closed up a bit early tonight - we got a curt, nasty, tall caucasian man who was rather argumentative. Through the window we could see they already had the food wrapped up and everything put away, which means we didn't just miss them - they had been breaking down and closing for at least 15 minutes already. But hey a little politeness and a smile goes a long way.

Is a little hole in the wall place but definitely worth a visit. Good food and great prices. I enjoyed the Chicago Dawg and a bucket of Fries with and ice cold coke.  It's an easy choice for a quick lunch on a nice summer day.

Devil Dawgs, you will forever hold a special place in my heart. Your dawgs are incredibly tasty and the crowd was always waiting for more. I never walked away dissatisfied and thank you for all of the good times!

Went there before and loved it. After tonight I may never go back. I walked up at 10:30 to the door that says open until 11 every night. Door was locked with staff standing at the door. Despite my continuous knocking and standing basically in front of them I was rudely ignored. Very unhappy

Love them kick ass burgers with the green chilis!  I'm mostly writing because i hate that people are trying to close them down because they are a late night favorite. Can't an institution survive in this neighborhood? It's not like the place attracts a raucus crowd.. they're just revelers trying to get some good eats. Where else can someone go late night besides Allendes around here? If they're forced to relocate i hope it's close by on webster, fullerton, or lincoln... apparently streets where it's acceptable to have a succesful food operation! The one star off is because it was closed at 10:30 on a Thursday - which is odd when the whole place is plastered with signs saying they're open until 11 every night. Probably the neighbor's fault.  Love, Bodega

Holy cow!! What a waste of a great location. You will never meet a more pompous owner of a hot dog stand (excluding mike north of course). If only his food was as perfect as he is. Fries were soggy and not cooked all the way through.  Hot dog was rubbery and probably left over from the night before seeing as how I was there at 11 am. When I asked to talk to the manger the GENTLEMAN behind the counter said he was the owner and I was crazy. I understand that he is used to dealing with drunk college kids at midnight but I am a 40 something on my lunch break.  It was a bit pricey for a hot dog and fries.  I don't mind paying for quality but there was none. The owners arrogance is the only reason I even posted anything.  You can get a bad meal from the best of places it is how they handle it that makes it a quality place.

Unseasoned small ass burgers,  hard ass fries,  staff with bad mf attitudes,  mad that i wasted my time coming here.  Glad it closes early,  its a disgrace to the neighborhood like the drunk ass DePaul kids.

Rating upon only the food items I got, their Chicago Dog ($2.95) was piled with onions, relish, pickle, tomato, sports peppers, and mustard. Overemphasized on mustard a bit. The bag of fries ($1.95) were crispy and flavored enough.

I looked at the menu and decided to buy a burger. As they were taking it off the gril I noticed it was not a burger at all, but more like a slider. I asked "Is that a burger or a slider?" The guy responded "Oh it's a slider man, they're all sliders sorry." Well how about you change your menu to say slider and not burger dude? Do you really think I'm not going to be pissed off when I thought I was getting a burger and it comes out as a $4 slider?

There's something disgustingly good about this place. It satisfies your soul even though you know it's clogging your arteries. Come and try it out. There's no place to sit down and eat but it's more of a take out place anyways. They have a wide variety of hot dogs and other sandwiches creatively made and they taste good.

Their Elvis burger would do the late King proud! Bacon, peanut butter, cheese, and Sriracha sauce makes this symphony of greasy grub sing. Grab a bucket of Coney cheese fries - with the most authentic Coney sauce west of New York I've ever had. Thanks for being in my neighborhood.

Crazy cheap and all around great. I got a basic cheeseburger, a Chicago dog, and a giant bucket of fries for under $8. I'm not sure if I'll be back in the winter, since there's no dining area, but for the summer when I can eat at their picnic table, I'm all about it.

Lackluster service, lackluster food. Comparable to a Subway airport franchise in terms of food quality, the service experience is even worse. Yet still expensive without basis. I live in the neighborhood, have sampled this place over the years, ate there again today because I was with students. I've earned a permanent pass from this less than supermarket-quality place henceforth. Just thought to share, no accolades, no grudges.

Love!!!  Is it okay for my favorite restaurant to be a hot dog place?  They use natural casing Chicago red hot dogs made on the south side and real hand cut potatoes so it's practically healthy.  But the fried buttermilk chicken with spicy slaw on a pretzel bun, that's just devilishly good.

This place is good because you come here so drunk, you don't really know what they serve you or what you're eating. You only know it's food and in this state of mind, food is good. It's inexpensive and quick. I would never come here sober or during the day, so I'm not sure why people do that but to each their own.  You can get a bucket of fries which is amazing. The fries are greasy but perfect for when you're drunk. I don't remember what hot dog I had, or if I had a hot dog or hamburger, but I remember drunk me being really happy with the food. It's located near DePaul so if you're visiting and looking for something late night, definitely give this place a try. Treat the workers with respect and they will do the same. They deal with drunk college students all the time, so a little kindness goes a long way here.

First I liked this place and food but people who work there not so nice and food handling I'm not so sure if they're clean I've complained about the bags and fries that they never covered they always comes out of the bag and it doesn't look so good to eat after it all came out of the paper.. Don't you think?
These a-holes advertise that they are open until 3:30 am on Saturday nights and even have employees in there at 3 am with the open sign on.  However, their lazy ass employees lock the doors at 3am.

I think the common thread between reviews is that this place is a great "late night spot." Now imagine eating here for a late lunch (sober) like I did today. I ordered the polish with giardiniera (+.50). And since I was with my boyfriend the bucket O fries. We got our food, opened the package and both of us were immediately turned off by the extremely soggy cheap-o grocery store brand bun. My polish was the red meat kind too, which I know there is a bratwurst-esque polish-not sure of the difference except that I don't really care for the red kind. With all the obvious signs-cheap meat, soggy greasy bun, I are the whole thing anyway to be here hours later writing this review with horrible indigestion. Almost immediately after finishing I had heart burn. The days of having a "stomach of steel" in college are over. Oh and the bucket O fries were fine-they were just that: a bucket filled with skinny fries and what you expect from a walk up type establishment, what fries aren't good (besides maybe KFC potato wedges?)  Anyway, the bottom line is this place has an interesting menu but is only good for a gut bomb that guarantees you plenty of weird stomach sounds later.
It was really just OK- I had a simple charred polish and it was nothing spectacular as I was hoping it might be...
favorite late night place! fries are delicious as well!!! also love that they stay open very late!

Could potentially be overhyped by any person under the influence of a great deal of alcohol, but never ceases to disappoint when in need of a classic chicago dog... or "dawg" as they like to call it. My suggestion... never go sober. Something about their "dawgs," man. The onion smell was in our car come morning EVEN THOUGH the hot dog was finished within the first two minutes of having them.  Talk about a ghost dog!  If you go, I recommend going with the classic Chicago Dawg. The others might sound appealing, but they won't after you take a bite. You can never go wrong with getting what you know is already good.  Go to Devil Dawgs after having a couple (or more) drinks, get a good dawg and go home
This place is perfect for late night food! My husband goes way more than me but the food is really quick and super good!!  It would also be a good spot to bring kids for a quick bite during the day.

We were looking for a Chicago style hotdog before we left back home to Dallas. This place makes good style hotdogs. It had the dil it had the sauce it was what I think of a Chicago style dog. It's in a really nice spot quick and easy very affordable. Parking is a b but I'm starting to realize that's everywhere in Chicago.

Love this place. Quick, friendly, and very yummy! I needed some grease after a night out on the town and Devil Dawgs did the trick. Burger was smaller than I expected, but the fries took care of the rest of my desire for more. Next time I will have a double and share my fries.  Keep in mind it is best for take out. On a nice day they do have two benches outside, but it's next to an ally and maybe not your most lovely view if you care to have one. Enjoy!

Exactly what the doctor ordered. Decently priced dogs and burgers - and a lot of fries. No skimping in my experience.  Burger was on the small side, I'd certainly suggest getting a double or more (or maybe a second one), everything else was pretty awesome. Can't complain about crispy, well-cooked fries smothered in cheese sauce! Set up seemed a little weird, though I think it works, no seating (except for a couple of outdoor picnic tables), so it's carry-out only. Quick and polite service, would definitely go back.
This is a great place perfect to go to after a late Saturday night. The Chicago dog is amazing along with the hand cut fries. This satisfies my craving for burgers fries and dogs any day of the week

Mmmm! Steak burger was perfect, think little steak and shake burger but better. Yes it's small, so order two... They're cheap.  Fries were fresh cut, just how they should be. Perfect amount of crispy and tenderness and nice amount of salt. Chicago dog wasn't perfect. No poppy seed bun which stinks, but the rest is on par.  Yes the place is small, but the food was great and cheap! I might go back right now to get seconds...mmmm steak burger

I recently discovered Devil Dawgs when I was craving for a hot dog. Imagine my surprise when I found out this place is just down the street from DePaul. Now I can have a delicious dog with fries whenever I'm on campus. So far I've only tried the Coney Island dog but it definitely quenched my craving. The fresh cut fries are simple and tasty as well. The sliders here are also surprisingly good. They're SO MUCH better than the sliders at White Castle. If you've got a few bucks and are in the mood for hot dogs or sliders, this is THE place to go!

I'll miss you, Hot Doug's...but Devil Dawgs more than makes up for this, with dirt-cheap fries, dogs and burgers, all of which were some tasty sh*t.  Tried the Sloppy Spicy Joe Burger today and the Jose Caliente Devil Dawg.  Wow; sauces and toppings on both were incredible, and the dog for the Jose Caliente was one of the best I've had in Chicago.  All of this, a bucket of fries with the spicy sauce and two sodas came out to $15.50.  Counter style and a small patio out back round it out for me...can't believe I had not been here before now!

For real! This place is open late, super late-as in, I have finished consuming every alcoholic beverage available in Chicago late.  Their food is amazing!! It has a very Cali feel with great food. You have to get the Elvis burger, the perfect combination of sweetness and spice. Also, get a bag of fries, don't be a cheap ass! Get the Devil sauce which is just spicy mustard, ketchup, sriacha and mayo but it really makes the fries! Also, don't be that person who orders something and customizes it to take things off, that basically takes away from what you are ordering.  There is outdoor seating available, if you don't like that, your only other option is to take it to go cause there is no space.

On my recent [and first] trip to Chi-town, I was determined to try the pickle-rich, ketchup-free Chicago hot dog.  Yet with a short timetable and a laundry list of amazing food to try, this iconic tubed meat began to drift downward on my priority list. Unfortunately, our initial flight into O'Hare was cancelled! Bad weather or some such nonsense. With that, my food itinerary was in disarray. Plan A, B and C were not in the cards as we weren't going to get to the South Loop until 12:30AM at the earliest. The native-Angelino in me, familiar with the late-night food carts of Downtown LA,  instinctively reverted to Plan D, which obviously stood for "Plan Dog".  I performed a yelp search based on late-night eats in the South Loop and out popped Devil Dawgs.  After dropping our bags at the AMAZING Blackstone Renaissance Hotel , we took a 3 block stroll to just South of Polk on State street. It was nearly 1AM and only slightly drizzling. "Don't ask for Ketchup...Don't ask for Ketchup" I reminded myself as we entered the lively South Loop Devil Dawg location.  There are two devilish locations in the city - one in the South Loop near Columbia University and a plethora of art colleges and the other in Lincoln Park, home of DePaul University. Cheap and Unique are the two factors which make for a successful college-oriented food business -- Devil Dawgs has mastered both. With reasonable prices and three towering menus of both traditional and progressive dawg preparations to choose from, Devil's has established itself as today's go-to quick dog and a late-night staple. Also noteworthy, Devil's is one of the only vendors in the city to use Chicago Red Hots for their sausage varieties.  Oh how I had dreamt of the first bite! A juicy dog topped with mustard, tomatoes, a pickle spear, relish, onions, sport peppers and celery salt enveloped by a poppyseed bun! Being a bona fide pickle head, I was dazzled by this vinegar-heavy approach to tubed meat. It's right up their with Banh Mi as one of my favorite eats below $3. Yet, to my surprise, this wasn't the star of the Devil Dawg show.... Seoul Dawg! An unforgettable Chicago Red Hot topped with Shoyu Mustard and Kimchi! So good, it could rightly be used as a tool to bring about world peace. The heat of the red hot, savory acidity of the mustard and sour/fermented touch of the kimchi came together as a harmonious symphony in my mouth! In truth, Devil's WAS a last resort for us last Friday; however, it was one of those happy accidents which re-ignited my desire to live in the moment and stray from researched food once in a while.

The Elvis quite possible might be the most delicious thing I have ever eaten. Do note it is a slippery slope...once you have one you will find yourself going back and back again. The steak burger alone is savory and delicious but add peanut butter/sriracha? Sweet baby Jesus have mercy!

Good stuff.  The Double Kick Ass is the best!  The Double Spicy Sloppy Joe is excellent!  Morning Burger is delicious! Fries are always great.  Friendly staff too! (I'm a regular.) Open LATE on the weekends.

I get my hair cut across the street at Great Clips so I usually stop here for a Chicago-style dog and fries. Dogs are always good and the fries tasty. My only ding is the size of the fries- they're like dwarf regular fries- maybe 1" or 1 1/2" long. I've never seen fries this small, so I have to believe they're processed by some food service vendor and not hand cut like Five Guys. Always friendly counter service and the prices are rights.

I wish I saw this place before eating at Taste of Sheffield yesterday. Hands down the best french fries I've eaten. I got a bucket of fries. Incredible! The food here was probably better than most of the food stands at the fest. A great neighborhood place and destination joint for those memory burn meals one doesn't forget. I can only imagine how crazy busy this place is on Friday and Saturday nights.

To me, this is the best place for hot dogs in the city and they close at 3am which makes it even better. Although my favorite thing to get is their burgers. They're always made fresh and the singles are in between the siZe of a slider and a normal burger so it's just enough for when I get the craving of a burger. It's also unbelievably cheap so for the price and the taste you get it's unbelievable. I recommend this place to everyone

My favorite hot dog place in Lincoln park ! The topping to hot dog ratio is perfect. The prices are good and it's a place I always bring my friends when they visit the city.  It's especially good after a night out at the bars.

Scanning through the menu, I see a lot of weird/creative combinations that I'm thinking won't taste good. But then  see the Elvis Burger - a bacon cheeseburger with sriracha and peanut butter (WTF). Look, I love peanut butter, and I love sriracha but I have never thought to put them together. I order this and a chicago dog (good), and I delightfully smack my lips through that peanut buttery burger. It was a bit on the small side, even though I got a double burger, but still. I'm now convinced that I should put peanut butter and sriracha on everything I eat.
Come from near or far to get the kickass burger ASAP

After a somewhat frustrating day, I decided to stop into this restaurant, which is near DePaul University.  When I first walked in, I was a little disappointed there was no place inside to sit and eat.  It's strictly carry out.  But the food was delicious!  The fries were some of the tastiest that I have ever had in my life.  They are not the size that most of us are used to, but the portion given was satisfying.  As for the the hot dog I ordered, it was cooked just right -- very good!  I asked for a combo meal, and a good size drink comes with that to wash the food down.  The next time I'm over that way, I will make a point of stopping there again.

Best slaw dawg. I think they're only ones who put slaw on too of their dogs and I love it. I got it all through college and now occasionally go with my old roommates and girlfriend. They're amazing. Definition of happiness... Literally.

Okay, so let's be honest about this place...you go here after a night on the town when you need something to coat your stomach from all the booze you've just consumed. That being said, even as tipsy as we were, those in my party couldn't consume half of our hot dogs because they weren't even cooked, and were in fact COLD. It was actually pretty disgusting.  The fries were good, the burgers are greasy but also okay after a night out on the lash.... I mean, I guess I can't be too hard on the place, it's a tiny little shack, lol...However, I probably won't pick this place again after a night out...

Decided to go here after many people told us we were missing some of the best hotdogs and fries in the city. Since we don't live to far away we decided to wonder down there late at night, plus we like to people watch and figured it would be funny to see drunk DePaul students.  I decided to get the Coney Dog add cheese and omg so good and perfectly cheesy. My husband got the Chicago Dog...the classic. He thought it was good, but of course not that different from other Chicago Dog's just as long as they have all the correct ingredients. We also got the bucket of cheese fries....yes I said BUCKET! It was amazing and no we did not have a heart attack after either. Definitely recommend trying these, amazing drunk food...mmmmm

Super friendly staff in a tiny shack. The menu's pretty straightforward and simple, so it's easy to navigate this place. I got the Chicago dog ($2.75) and the single hamburger ($1.69). Both were nice but pretty underwhelming. The chicago dog (no ketchup, of course) comes packed with all the standard condiments, though they use a plain bun, not a poppy seed bun. The artificially green relish was slightly bothersome, but hey, it's relish.  The hamburger was just that: a bun, patty and some onions + ketchup/mustard. Nothing more than that. For under $2, it's a great deal, but you'd be sorely disappointed if you were comparing these to those $10 burgers with big juicy patties. Great place for a quick stop and some fast food, but not much beyond that.

This place is the definition of simple greatness. The prices are low, the place is tiny, and the "dawgs" are delicious. I had the Slaw Dog, which was generously smothered with very good cole slaw (not too heavy on the mayo) and celery salt. When you're looking for this place, keep your eyes peeled. It's so little and nondescript that I passed it twice.

I mean what more could you ask for besides double-layered cheese fries the size of mount everest and classic chicago hot dog combos? This place is one of my favorites and I have not come across one thing on the menu that my taste buds don't like yet.  The only negative is I would say that it is way too small on certain weekend nights, the line goes out the door and around the alley.  Could definitely use a bigger inside!  If you're a first timer, I would recommend chomping down on the Morning Burger or the Taco Diablo Dawg OR the Demon Dawg. I really can't decide what's best!

Their Chicago hot dog is just like most other little hot dog stands in the city, so I can't give much of a review on that one. My one comment is that there was a TON of celery salt on mine...so much that I had to wipe some off. Not much trouble, but just a little too salty/celery-y. Clark ordered an original burger with bacon and loved it, though it was pretty tiny. I'd say McDonald's cheeseburger size, but for like $4. (In a contest of McD's vs. DD though, DD wins for sure.) The fries were cut into nuggets rather than long thin things you can pick up, so that made them frustrating to eat. They're probably meant more for fry orders with stuff on top so that you have to eat with a fork.

This is my late night/mid-day/anytime go to. As a DePaul Student, I have been to Devil Dawgs several times and have literally never been disappointed; It's a great change of pace from campus dining.  One of my faves, which I get every time I go, is the "Bacon Cheddar Dawg," Shredded cheddar, melted cheese, BACON!!!! I'm getting one today! Also the fries are great, they're heavy handed with those, so that's always good... It's small and can get crowded late at night on the weekend, but 9 times out of 10, you'll either be drunk or starving, and that just amplifies the already amazing goodness that's about to shoveled into your face. You don't mind the wait/crowd. GO HERE!

Interesting spot for a quick snack.  Very, very small.  They have a few picnic tables outside on good weather.  I had a mini burger - hit the spot but nothing out of the ordinary. Fries were really quite good.

Best Burger I've had in a while..  simple and delicious burger.Not overbearing with toppings and huge patties that other burger places tout. Just simple delicious burger that reminds me of burgers I use to get at my local diner growing up...

Hands down best burger I have ever had under $5. Oh yeah, it was $1.59. Put 5 guys to SHAME! Also had a Coney with Cheese. Great taste. Also shared a Slaw dog, great tasting coleslaw,  Devil Dawgs is now my GOTO place for dogs and AMAZINGLY delicious burgers.

As a DePaul student, I think our whole student body can agree that we love school spirit (except the time it broke free from the dungeon below DePaul Cathedral and slaughtered the women's basketball squad) and Devil Dawgs is a true DePaul great.  Though, you may think the rumors silly that Devil Dawgs got their recipes from the Devil, after recoving the legal documentation Devil Dawgs filed for a food license I found several markings emblazoned in the paperwork in an ancient unspeakable tongue and signatures in blood.  This unholy pact is what makes Devil Dawgs so good and, after all, we're all Blue Demons at DePaul and worship sin and Our Unholy Lord of Darkness so this paired with location makes for a great combo after a difficult occult physics final or orgy in the family restroom at The Ray Fitness Facility.  Go Blue Devils and Hail Satan! we're #666!!!!!!!

Nothing like good ole Devil Dawgs. I simply cannot think of my experience here at DePaul University without my countless, sometimes drunken late night trips to Devil Dawgs! It can get really hectic here late night, but that is all apart of the Devil Dawgs experience. The staff here is awesome. Get that bucket of fries, the Jose Caliente Dawg, and the Kick Ass Burger, and you are set for one hell of a good meal.

I'm not as big of a fan of Devil Dawgs as everyone else. But for what it's worth, it's still a mighty decent hot dog. And for as long as there's been DePaul University, there's been Devil Dawgs right next to it. OK not quite as long but let's just say Devil Dawgs is a neighborhood fixture. It may be about as big as a corner store, but it's not uncommon to see lines trailing out the door on a typical night. The Devil Dawg is the big seller here and is basically a Chicago-style dog without the tomatoes, dill pickle and celery salt. Devil Dawgs is also known for their fresh cut French fries, which come with a side of Coney sauce for a little extra. Try some and you may never need ketchup again (at least on French fries).

Been to Devil Dawgs a few times ... and they have satiated my craving for encased meat each and every time. The dogs & toppings are fresh, and the fries are quite tasty as well.  Very easy on the wallet as well - just a bit difficult to go in winter as there's no seating, and in the summer it's hot as balls inside when they have the grills going (which is all the time). Drunk or sober, this place is a good place to get your dog fix.
I loved the hot dogs and french fries here!  And the atmosphere was awesome!  Really tiny, total dive... Can't wait to go back!

Wow, it feels really good to cross off one of the oldest bookmarks in my queue (I really am keeping my new year's resolutions!) which had been there since Time Out Chicago's "Best Things We Ate" 2010 version. Made my way to DD yesterday evening, fully intending to eat there, but we had to take our food to go. As in *had* to--there's literally no seating AT ALL, save for a picnic table or two outside which wasn't really conducive on an evening in January (and yes, I know it was 45 degrees yesterday, but still). I recalled from the TOC list that ordering a single steak burger was, well, in order, so I opted for that. Then I saw the size and description: a 2 oz. burger?! Yes, apparently. These things are tiny, like if White Castle and Five Guys had a baby, these burgers would be it. I ended up ordering a double, hoping that would suffice (since a triple sounded piggish), my bf ordered a "Blue Demons Dawg," (a nod to nearby DePaul who I imagine gives them tons of business) and a bucket of fries. In an ode perhaps to White Castle, they combine their ketchup and mustard into one brown, unappealing (at least looks-wise) sauce. I enjoy both ketchup and mustard on my burgers but I actually like to see the two different colors. Call me anal, but the two condiments taste completely different, and mixed together is just not good. This was especially true when I noted that DD uses the dreaded Red Gold brand of ketchup and not Heinz. Heinz is king. End of. By default, they put onions on the burgers, but they're raw and not cooked, so if you don't want them, speak up as I did. I also had a sneaky suspicion that the fries sitting in the holding pan had been there a while, but I didn't want to be a bitch and ask for fresh fries; in hindsight, I should have, because I may have been right. Anyway, like I said, we had to take our food home with us (so it's a good thing we don't live too far away) and naturally the fries were cold and limp by the time we unpacked our food. A quick reheat in our toaster over (don't ever microwave fries!) rendered them back to almost what I presume is their original glory. Excellent fries (twice-cooked if I'm not mistaken): crispy, thin, and salty, just like I like 'em. The burger was good, tasty even, but if you're like me and used to a bigger piece of meat (wait, what?), then these diminutive burger patties may not appeal to you. Still, for what it was, it was enjoyable, and I'm told that the dog was deeply satisfying as well (they don't serve Vienna hot dogs, but the South Side brand "Red Hot Chicago") with its "devil sauce," kraut, and spicy mustard. I liked Devil Dawgs just fine. It was cheap eats and friendly service, but a few things annoyed me (lack of seating, no Heinz ketchup). I guess the devil is in the details, as they say.
Devil Dawgs for DePaul students are heaven at 2am, the cheese dawgs and chili cheese fries are great!

UThis place is great. I've been coming here since my days at DePaul and Iraq was great then. They have since expanded their menu so there is a lot more to try, so make sure to pop in as they have not updated their menu on yelp. The steak burgers are awesome and the Coney fries are on of the best things I have ever tried. Staff is very nice and the owner is very knowledgeable. Local, cheap and great tasting.

I have been on the fence about this review. Since I was unsure I went back a few times so I could feel confident offering an opinion. This is more like 2.5 stars for me. I didn't completely dislike it, I have indeed experienced better, but I do plan to return so I feel 3 stars is as fair as I can possibly be in this situation.  The good: The ingredients are fresh. The dogs pop like they should. The staff is friendly. You can watch your food being prepared. And the fries - OMFG. I ordered the fries the first time I went and I planned to "try" a few, then discard the rest. Well, I ate the entire bag before I took a bite of my hot dog and I am not one of those people who neurotically eat one food at a time. I simply couldn't stop. I was aware of the situation and I just didn't care. They are so good. They are crisp, which I prefer. They are fresh cut. They are like french fried crack. Proceed with caution.  The dawgs: I have tried the Chicago dog, the coney dog and the southern slaw dog. The southern slaw dog is my favorite so far. I love cole slaw and they do a great cole slaw! It also includes mustard, pickle and celery salt. The Chicago dog was unimpressive. Everything was fresh, but I've had better at O'Hare airport (no joke). The coney dog was somewhere in between. The coney sauce was a little sweet, which caught me off guard, but I think I liked it. It could have used more onions. If I were to assign stars to the dawgs, the Chicago dog would get a 2, the coney a 3 and the slaw dog a 4.  I will go back - but mainly because it's close to my apt and close to campus. M search for the perfect Chicago dog continues.

The french fries are so addictive, you cannot just have a few. Like the hot dogs a lot and they have a great coleslaw that I had the last time I was there. Glad they are walking distance from our house! Just wish they had some indoor seating for the winter!
best. cheese. fries. ever. *make sure to tell them to layer the cheese! .....you will thank me later

I'm so disappointed that they don't do Grubhub or Seamless anymore, they're cheap, small and delicious which is good because you can try a bunch of different ones. While not the best Chicago-style hot dog I've had in Chicago some of the best original hot dogs and burgers I've had in my life. Definitely go for the spicier items on the menu, that's what I do. But yeah this place must feel like heaven when hungover. I think I might just get drunk for the reason of eating these awesome dawgs when i'm hating myself and then love myself again.

The hot dogs and fries are AMAZING!!!! My boyfriend and I can both eat and get stuffed for under 10 bucks!! Not to mention we live across the street:)  Also, you only need 1 order of fries because they are huge orders!!!

Ordered a double cheeseburger.  AMAZING!  All the ingredients just came together really well.  I was truly impressed.  Also had a side of fries.  The potatoes were definitely fresh and the seasoning was good, but I think the fries are just slightly overdone.  You can't beat the prices at this place.

This place is a necessity to the DePaul community - where would we be if we didn't have a good place to get a hot dog (or a burger) from an establishment that feels like an indoor hot dog stand? Yummy food, specially love the burgers, despite their size. I'd expect a 10-minute wait time during their average hours, but expect this place to fill up fast, and there's not much for seating room except the outdoor benches.

Honestly one of the best late night Chicago hot dog place in Lincoln. They are always open late on the weekends, so I recommend getting it after you leave the bar. Occasionally, there will be a huge line and it will take a while to get food, but trust me it is worth it. I recommend getting their cheese fries as well. They are my favorite cheese fires in Chicago. The staff is very nice and usually DePaul students since it is located right on campus. All in all, Devil Dawgs is a solid late night hot dog place and everyone should give it a try.
Devil Dawgs doesn't get nearly as much publicity as they deserve. Not only are the prices great, their array of hot dogs are second to none. Their namesake Devil Dawg is my go-to

So tasty for late night runs! I love the actual Devil Dog. The sport peppers on it are so good. I haven't really tried the other dogs. I also love the burgers. Such a greasy delight! After a long night, these were total heaven for me and a friend to the point we ignored a guy trying to start a conversation with us. We just looked at each other with expressions of happiness on our faces. It is a really small joint though. So lines can come out the door easily. The people working there are really friendly.  Good place to check out.

The crew down the street at Rugby RL suggested DD after I asked them to make a local recommendation.  Dogs were all right.....I was expecting a harder case weenie.....but nothing special. I'd drill the idiot smart mouth working the register for taking a shot at me in front of my family (which I didn't deserve), but he gave us an order of their "world famous" fries to try out at no charge.....which buys the place an extra star on my scorecard.  Fine, but hardly worth any kind of special trip.

Well, let's talk about the pluses. This place has wonderful hot dogs, great fries and it's open late at night. It's the perfect place to grab a quick snack if you are in the area at night. However, there are a couple of negatives that I can think of. Firstly the place is tiny and by tiny I mean really really tiny. Secondly some of the workers can be slow. This especially matters if there are a lot of people waiting in line. But still, I would recommend this place nonetheless.

Midnight on a Saturday night - best time to try your first Chicago dog! I just wanted it quick and easy, so I could finally see what I've been missing! These guys definitely delivered! Even among so many drunken college kids flying in and out of that tiny shop, flirting with the young guys across the counter and shouting absurd comments, I was able to handle waiting the 10 minutes it took for 3 traditional, fully loaded, Chicago dogs to come flying down the countertop in a brown paper bag. That hot dog snapped with every bite, and that kosher pickle with the rest of the toppings made it. I am officially a Chicago dog girl.

I'm not entirely sure why I feel compelled to write a review about this place, but as I went out of my way to eat there with my scoutmob coupon, I can go out of my way to review them online.  Devil Dawgs is a hot dog joint first (as the name would imply) but a serious eats writeup praised the burgers more and that's what I came for. The lowdown- good, but small as others have said.  Unfortunately, nothing else at this place did much for me. It might be because after being recommended the polish, it was served cold. My friend's hot dog was a similar situation. In addition to being gross to taste, I can only imagine how long these were sitting around. The fries were good (although I might dispute the employee's claim that they're the only fresh cut fries in the city- c'mon son). The cheese sauce is standard liquid cheese they apply by the gallon. It's no different than what is served at 99% of hot dog joints in the city. Just a big mess. Perhaps I expected more than I should of out of a hot dog joint. Devil Dawgs, I hardly knew you. Also, you should turn the dubstep down inside.

Was working for a few months up the street and this place kept us well fed and very content 3 times a week. Great quality, little burgers on a perfectly rich and buttery little bun. It's a burger stand, just a few picnic tables outside.  Back to the burgers....great quality, owner said the beef comes from an MN I think, and its quality ground steak...not cheap ass IBP frozen stuff. The gauge of quality for me is how I feel after...this is a no-gut bomb place (unlike Epic Burger, for instance), where you feel just fine even if you gouge on a few double burgers. I love the size of these burgers because I can order one double cheese and have a Chicago dog, and it's good size meal...get the best of both worlds..dogs and burgers. It's priced right and clearly satisfies even the Depaul student's budget. One of the best burgers stands in Chicago for sure!
I like this place.. it's cheap..it's fast. Not the best I've ever had. The hot dog could use a little more pizazz, but hell it's a couple of bucks and your in and out. Cute place.

I tried this place when some friends dragged me to the nearby McGee's. I only had one beer in me and McGee's' kitchen had just closed, so my boyfriend and I went to go find a place we spotted while on our way to the bar. Lo and behold, we fell upon (well, walked, we really weren't drunk) the steps of Devil Dawgs, a place that would forever change my life in food terms. The wait was a tad long considering there were no people in front of us, but perhaps that was a good thing because we ended up getting freshly fried french fries. OH MY GOD The french fries. I couldn't believe it. I couldn't stop eating them. They were just plain fries, but they were the most delicious, perfectly fried and cut fries I'd ever had. They were the blissful combination of not too salty, with a hint of sweetness. I like my fries not too thin, not too think, and soggy, and that's exactly how they were. You must TRY the FRIKIN FRIES. I've had McDonald's, Burger King's old and new fries, Wendy's' old and new fries, other restaurants', bars', fast food places', and hot dog joints' fries, and I don't know what Devil Dawgs did that night, but it was love at first taste.  You may be wondering why I knocked a star off. Well, it was pretty cold out, and there's not so much as a single seat inside, so luckily they still had their seating set up outside (we don't have the luxuries of a car to sit in), so that was half a star because I realize it's a costly endeavor to remodel in such a way as to accommodate seating in such a small place. Another half of a star was off because the hot dogs we had weren't quite anything super unique or out-of-this-world tasty, but pretty good. (I had the hot dog with melted cheese and bacon. I forget what it's called). I would certainly go here again. It kind of sucks that it's so far away from where I live (on the opposite side of the city, practically), because now whenever I go out for a night of drinking I want to go here, too :(
I LOVE DEVIL DAWGS. i am a depaul student and the place is in the perfect location and the hot dogs are good and cheap. MUST GET THE TUB OF CHEESE FRIES! DELICIOUS!

Being a DePaul student, I have to like this place! I have never been here for late night eats but I can only imagine the appeal and the crowd. I went for a sorority fundraising event and it was amazing. I ordered a cheese dog with a side of fries. The cheese dog had squeeze cheese on it but it was also covered in shredded cheddar. It was amazing and I was craving for one the next day. The fries were okay but paired well with the hotdog. The only reason why I'm not giving this place five stars is that some people are extremely crazy! A man was trying to redeem a flyer for the fundraiser and the man at the counter (older, I assumed to be the owner) was yelling at him! How rude! I don't care how busy you are or how much you hate doing the fundraiser, you agreed to do it so get with it and stop complaining. He then yelled at me to wait outside while my food was coming up, no need to yell sir. Maybe if this guy had an attitude adjustment, I would come by more.

OK dogs - they could use a little bit more favor. But employees are super friendly and for around 3 bucks each, I was satisfied.  The benches outside are cute, but the winter is coming, so I'm not sure how practical they will be. The fries looked amazing but we didn't try some, definitely will come back for their fries. If you're in the area, stop by for a quick lunch, and take lots of napkins, they tend to get messy.

Omg. The devil dawgs  are so good at 2 am after a night out.. The guys working the counter seem a little sketchball at times...but it's also the middle of the night. Pretty laid back little spot that tons of young depaulians flock too. for thee best hotdogs go to Weiners circle! I bet devil dawgs doesn't taste that good sober...

had the breakfast burger yesterday (along with a coney dog) and it was ammazing. cant wait to go back and get two!!! consists of a patty, bacon, egg and ketchup and comes as a single, double, or triple.  ive never considered a burger here before but i am glad i finally tried it.

Shhhh, please don't tell everyone about the best kept secret in Chicago!  I know all about Hot Dogs and the health benefits which is why I do things in moderation.  So, when I passed by this place with my wife and kids, I had to stop.  It just looked like one of those places where they serve good food period.  So, I we stopped in for hot dogs, burgers and fries.  And, it was very yummy.  There are only a few seats available outdoors, so be prepared to stand up or eat on the go.  But, I guarantee you will like the food.  Have a hot dog every now and then, it is an American pastime.

I took my visiting boyfriend here one day for lunch-- and he ended up going back three more times before he left a week later! Why? Because this place is both tasty and cheap!  This place is great for a quick bite during the long summer days or a hangover helper post drinking in the DePaul/ LP area. It has officially become my favorite drunk food spot. There can sometimes be lines late at night, but it's well worth it! The fries are crispy and just greasy enough.  The burgers are a bit bigger than sliders and very flavorful-- these are my favorite. The dogs are also really yummy!  Also, this is a true Chicago hot dog joint because they yell at your for wanting ketchup on your dog, just as they should!

Stopped in for Monday lunch while visiting a friend in Chicago (he was at work, I was bumming around). I got the devil dawg, chicago dog, and fries. Devil dawg didn't do much for me. It just set my mouth on fire and left me yearning for more meat. I appreciate the generosity in fixings, but when it completely overwhelms the dog, no thanks. The Chicago dog however was perfect! Toppings complemented the meat. And the fries were awesome. Think 5 Guys fries with way less grease. All in all, extraordinary value.
came here on a mini-hotdog tour, had a bite of a chicago dog (like i said, tour) and it was the best of the day! this place reminds me of red hot lovers in ann arbor, mi.
Strictly from a Chicago style perspective....does not hold up to the greats

Open Late and some of the best Fries I've had in the city. I give it 4 instead of 5 stars b/c they use standard Nacho Cheese for the cheese fries. If they amped it up to something along the lines of Merkts cheese, there would be a constant line out the door. Great lil' burgers, real decent dawgs and the staff is super friendly and tolerant in a neighborhood (DePaul students take-over) that gets rowdy as F*@#. They got the Merkts. Happiness.

Devil Dawgs is exactly the kind of place you want to find on a hot summer afternoon in Chicago. If I hadn't been out riding, I don't know if I ever would have found it. The whole place, kitchen and all could probably fit in my living room, tucked away between bars and an alley, it's the definition of a hole-in-the-wall. But those are the best places. I had a Chicago style dog, which was delicious and fixed out with all the trimmings, if a little heavy on the mustard. They also have their own recipe, the Devil Dawg, which appeared to be onions, mustard, hot peppers, and green peppers. Nom nom nom. The service is fast and the cashier is super-friendly, upon realizing that my change was going to be 97 cents, she asked if I had 3 cents to round out the dollar. I said no. She spotted the three cents "Which means you have to come back here." I don't know if that constitutes a contract, but I'll certainly be back.

I do not support the devil or his antics... but I do support Devil Dawgs!!! Oh my goodness. In a moment of trying to feel young again, I got a late night snack of french fries and italian ice.  I got the italian ice from annettes and the french fries from Devil Dawgs.   I kept repeating to my friend, "These are really good fries."  ..and unlike the devil, I was NOT lying. It's TRUE.  They are SO GOOD.  I know, how can I review this place when all I've had was fries (and not even the cheese fries, just the regular fries) ?!!?  Well, I'm reviewing it right now, and I'll I've had were fries, so it CAN be done friends. Since all I have to go on is the fries-- let me describe them in extreme detail. They are a little bit darker in color which initially worried me, since I tend to like lighter colored fries, and a darker color suggests potato skin-on and also may suggest burnt fries.  No worries friends!  They were not burnt nor was there 100% skin on.  There may have been some skin on but not enough to bother.  They were perfectly greasy and crunch, and PERFECTLY salty.  It is hard to master salt, let me tell you.  Fries are usually too salty (like say a mcdonalds fry) or not salty enough (like steak and shake or in n out).  They came in a brown bag with MY NAME ON THE BAG, just like my mom used to give me when I was a child and brought a lunch to school!!!! (except my mom was like, here's some bread and cheese and a marker, do it yourself).  Nonetheless it was nostalgic and TRULY a beautiful experience. Also, the man behind the counter was friendly, and the patrons seemed friendly as well.  I was worried since it was so late at night that everyone would be drunkards and mean to me, but that was not the case!!!! Lastly, I felt so cool that I was out late with the young kids eating french fries!!!!!  .... until my friend said something like "Stacey, it's 9:50 pm.  It is not that late." dang it.   i'll never be like the cool kids.

Whenever I exercise, knowing it's possible I may have lost some weight, I immediately try to eat it back on, preferably with hot dogs and fries.  In my view, that's the point of exercise: it gives you the chance to eat what you really want to eat.  Stop obsessing over Gatorade electrolytes and consume a post-workout meal you actually enjoy. Devil Dogs is right down the street from the DePaul gym and it makes it perfectly convenient to retrieve any burnt calories.  The staff is friendly with the fry scooper, for those who love quantity, and they have a handful of dog varieties, for those looking for more than a Chicago-style.  There's also a little outdoor seating space, which seems like it's dangerously close to the alley driveway entrance lane, but is still a good place to enjoy the summer weather at lunchtime.

WOW! I'm with my twin sister right now. We're both vegetarians and models so we are very weight conscious. Just came back from a night of drinking (!!) and stopped at devil dawgs with some friends. I am currently shoving a chicago dawg down my throat. it's the best thing i've ever eaten. Let me repeat: I'm a vegetarian.

finally had a steak burger - DELICIOUS! a little bigger than a white castle slider and essentially melts in your mouth.  Also tried the Polish - a little smaller than your standard sausage but just as tasty.  Also - if you bring your yellow cup back you get 50 cent refills!  hey bro why didn't you tell me that before I collected about 15 of them! Now fill up my pepsi!
I came here wasted one time and it's hard to tell whether the food was good or I was just that drunk. But anyways, it was a good experience and everyone I seem to talk to enjoys it.

Horrible experience. Walked in on a Saturday afternoon with three people working and was greeted with a hello sir but then was ignored for the next five minutes while all three of them worked in finishing other orders even though the place was empty instead of one person taking my order first. Finally someone else walked in that was one of the young guys buds and his order was taken right of way and before mine as I sat there with my jaw down to the ground. At this point I walked out and walked down to Etno's at Lincoln and Sheffield where I had amazing food and service for a similar fast food price.

A must go place if you are out partying and get hungry. Definitely a place for college kids and random drunk people. Fun atmosphere! Delicious sliders (I don't like hot dogs but everyone loves the hot dogs here). There fries are also out of this world, especially the coney cheese fries (they literally give you a bucket of them).
Love this place!  Always make a point to get this wonderful food after a night out in the city..  The bucket of cheese fries are to die for, and the cheese dog is yummy too!
omgz omgz.. Delicious.  The fries are probably the best thing there. Its all good though.

Yesssss. Everything is so cheap and delicious. I hear there's no place to park in this area, but I'm on bike, and have no problem. Oh $#!+, there's no place to sit. Not too far from Trebes Park, so I suppose you can grab some food and have a picnic in nicer weather. The burgers are the best. They are tiny, like sliders almost, but they're greasy and perfect smash burgers (could compare to 5 guys minus the hype?). But I just adore the way my fingers smell like mustard for hours after wolfing down a classic Chicago Dog.

Here is the low-down on this little hot-dog shop: -GREAT fries (but ask for them to be "easy on the salt" or otherwise they can be a bit too much). -CHEAP fries for the huge amount they give you. -FRIENDLY people working there. The dogs are good, but nothing amazing.  Meh, I've had better.  But if ya need a dog and some GREAT fries, then its a winner to go to eat.

Heaven in the devil. When I heard there was a new hot dog place in chicago, I was underwhelmed. But, having a craving one day I mozied into this new hot dog hot and was happy I did. Hot dogs were great and better than average. The coney with cheese (chili dog) was more than tasty with sharp onions and one of the best I have had in the city. The chicago dog had a nice bite with three sport peppers (one in every bite) which I enjoyed.  The burgers and cheese fries looked tantalizing as well. Need a dog fix when you are in the LP, go here. Your craving will be well satisfied

4 words.... Bucket o Cheese Fries!!!   I could not believe my eyes when I opened up my bag and had this literal bucket of deliciousness.  Awesome. Plain and simple, this is a hot dog stand.  It's basic, quick, reasonably priced and good.

It is exactly what it is.....a hotdog stand. Employees are very nice. Food is good. Location is pretty good, but I feel for the people that have their balconies directly over looking the picnic tables..... especially when they are open late to the bar crowd at 3am.  I wouldn't go out of my way to go here, but if I am walking from the El to McGee's again, I would stop for another hotdog.

OMG!  Why isn't any talking about the delicious steak burger?!  It's like the best thing that ever happened to burgers.  I can honestly say it's the only burger in town that I get cravings for.  All of the sudden, outta nowhere... I've got to go get one.   It's a double, the patties are small, the way the cheese melts into it, and the onions on it, and the sauce... Dang, now I need to go get one for dinner!

You have to rate places for what they are. That's how Ebert reviews movies, and that's my philosophy on Yelp. Devil Dawgs is a hot dog stand. You aren't going to have a sit-down meal here or blow a lot of money or take your hot date to grab a hot wiener (well, maybe if the date is going really well...). Get it? Grab a wiener! But when you just want a really good hot dog, Devil Dawgs is absolutely perfect. As far as hot dog stands go, it's the best I've ever been to. It's open all hours. The service is speedy. The people who work here are charming. And the food is phenomenal. Best thing on the menu? Not a hot dog. It's the steak burger. It's the favorite of the owner and all his employees too. Don't leave without an order of french fries. They are salty, greasy and delicious. The people here give you way too many, but who ever complained about getting too many french fries? Not this guy. (Insert Devil-Dawgs-being-more-heavenly-than-hellish quip here).

Get the 'Slaw Dawg! It's life changing.  This little place is a perfect little hot dog joint... open late night, great chili for the dogs and super friendly staff.  I would eat there everyday if I thought it wouldn't kill me.
Super friendly, efficient guys expertly served up great dogs in two minutes.  Very clean, professionally run little place

Tried for first time today. The dogs are the best since Demon Dogs closed. The hand cut fries are exceptional. Affordable pricing also, unless you pay with credit or debit they tack on a $3 penalty fee.

I drove by here on my way to a show at Uncle Fatty's last week. And I'm so glad I got caught by the light. The all-beef dogs and Polish sausage are delicious, but the addition of Coney Island dogs and mini steakburgers make the menu just about perfect. The only downside is that there's no onion rings, but the fries are tasty enough to excuse this oversight.  Throw in a student discount (10% w/ID), a friendly staff, and only a $3 minimum for credit cards, and you have just about the most no-nonsense, no frills hot dog stand in all the city.
This place is dangerously close to my apartment. Love their fries.  Love the prices. Love the friendly people. I am hooked.

Love this place. It is no Hot Doug's, they don't fry anything in elephant ass fat or wrap bacon around each french fry, but it IS a really solid place to go for a good dog or brat. Fries are very good, stringy, limp potato-skin kind; saltier the better. My girlfriend loves the Slaw Dawg, if you're into that (ME = despise cole slaw). Note that there is NO INDOOR SEATING, and only a couple of picnic benches outside; this is not where you bring the gang for a sit down; this is where you stand around at 1pm or 1am shoveling delicious into your face

Dry cleaner to hot dog stand.  How can you go wrong? Stopped by on a Saturday to support one of the new local businesses.  Place is super-small, though there are tables outside once the weather turns nice.  Menus is quite small too.  Ordered the Chicago Dog.  Was delicious and was only $2.25 (plus tax).  Two things I would change.  Dog needed a bit more "snap" when biting into it.  And they don't use poppy seed buns. Hours are late on the weekends, so I am sure there is high traffic from Kelley's and McGees late-night. Looking forward to going back and trying the fries.

I was a little skeptical at first because the place used to be a dry cleaners and looked a little cramped with all of the restaurant equipment jammed inside. I went in for a try and was surprised at how good the food was. It's a little small inside but well worth it because the hot dogs are only $2 and the fries (a large portion) are under $2. The Chicago style hot dogs are good and the fries were hand-cut, seasoned and delicious.  They are open pretty late and is good for late night munchies. They have a couple of tables for outdoor seating in warm weather, but besides that, it's basically a take-out place. If you're looking for cheap eats, this is a great place to try.
Best dog in Chicago since Demon Dogs.  The non Vienna red hot has so much falvor on its own.  The Coney dog (with onions and mustard) is great.  Fresh cut fries are always crispy.  Must try!

This is a great Chicago Hot Dog stand.  1) It serves a great Chicago hot dog.  It is fresh and complete with all the fixings (including sport peppers which I leave off) served up quick. The hot dog is a Chicago Red Hot brand which was started by the grandson of the Vienna Hot Dog founder.  It snaps when you bite into it.  Great!  2) The fries are hand cut and par boiled, which makes them crispy on the outside, tender and non-greasy on the inside.  Great!  I've not yet tried them cheese and chili, as I am a bit of a purist.  The staff has been good and attentive.  You watch them dress the dogs so if they aren't doing it the way you want it, just ask.  I would give them 5 stars if they has two seats in the place, but its a shack so I'll have to wait til summer to eat at the picnic tables they have ready to go outside.  This is great addition to the neighborhood, especially since Demon Dogs closed.  It's new so we have to patronize it to let it get established.  And for two bucks a quarter you can't beat it.

Stopped in with my boyfriend.  I asked for Chicago dog, no peppers, he got the coney dog and we both got cheese fries.  Our order was repeated back to us exactly as we had ordered it. Since there is literally nowhere to sit (or stand and wait for your order for that matter) we grabbed our bag of food and headed back to the car.  Opened bag-missing my Chicago dog.  My bf went back, and told them we were short a dog, they agreed to make it right away and he added, no peppers.  The girl behind the counter said, "oh thanks for letting me know that!"  We get home and guess what-peppers on my dog. With that being said, my dog was fairly good.  My bf, however, hated the coney dog.  He said it was so gross.  As for the fries, I didn't realize they were hand cut-my absolute least favorite kind of fry.  I was super disappointed, but if you like that kind of fry, I guess this would be a plus for you. All in all, the dog I had was ok, but since I hate the fries, I doubt I'll be back for one lousy dog when there are plenty of other places in the area that have my kind of french fries.   By the way, parking will definitely be a problem is DePaul is in session.  Walk if possible.

^                  ^               ^                    / \              / \                                              DEVIL DAWGS                   /   \_____/    \                   {    ^          ^     }                 ({    0         0     })                   I          ()         I                    I    _____    I                     \ '[ ^^^^^^^ ]'/                       I   ^^^^^   I                        \ _____/                               Well the graphics department was at it again and it seems they overestimated their abilities yet again.  To be fair it sounded so easy in theory but it looks like a drunk bat or an 2 year old childs' rendering of the next Dark Knight movie.           So on to the review, as a my continuing search for the best dogs in Chicago my journey led to Devil Dawgs in Lincoln Park.  I actually did not seek it out but rather stumbled on to it as its not in the most obvious spot and a little tucked away.  I am very glad I kept my head on a swivel as I do anytime I am in that area. I always fear either the elderly turning blind corners or the always terrifying Freshman coed texting while driving, these are always prevalent in the area.  So I wandered into the brightly colored establishment and ordered up your standard Chicago Dog, or dawg in this case.  I was floored(maybe that's generous)  this is a great dog.  They set it up with all the usual fixins but the relish really stands out, it is superb on par with the best in town.  The non Vienna beef red hot was a nice change of pace from the usually Vienna Beef standard. The prices are superb 2.00 for a basic dog and 2.25 for the Chicago Dog.  The staff is courteous and friendly and your dog comes out quick. Their is no where to sit exactly so its in and out and on to the next stop. Overall in the top tier of dogs in the city a must visit

It's ok. Decent. Whatever. I mean the dawgs are great but I judge a fast food place by the fries. And they aren't cutting it. The prices and the location is good, but the major plus is that it's a great place to get some late night grub after a night of partying on the weekends. It's OK.

Across the street from my apartment. This is a blessing. And a HUGE PROBLEM. I'm not a late night eater... but when it's right there? I mean RIGHT THERE, with its luring yellow and red glow calling my name at 2 AM how can I possibly resist?  The place is tiny. It gets crowded. It's fun. From what I usually remember. They harass you when you ask for ketchup on your dog. I don't give a crap. Oh, and the fries are un-freaking-believeable. Don't bother with the chili and cheese; I think they are great on their own.

The only attraction I had to this joint was the idea that I could get lunch for a 5 dollar bill.  But they raised the prices after the first week or so.   The late $2 hot dog was a deal, but $2.75 a piece (more if you want cheese) at a place the size of an airplane lavatory starts feeling like less of a bargain.  Two Coney dogs without fries or a drink is now $6+ after tax.  For that, I would go elsewhere.  Maybe somewhere I could sit down.

I would consider myself a hot dog connoisseur. Chowing down at places like Hot Dougs and the new...wonderful Chicago's Dog House is somewhat of a hobby of mine. The various specialty dogs (alligator, duck, bison) and wacky and superb toppings (avocado mayonnaise, homemade hot sauce) are usually what I scarf down. However a regular chicago dog or chicago polish is always a necessary break from the gourmet dogs.  So when i stepped into the small Devil Dawg diner and saw the giant blackboard overhead with only 5 types of dogs it was a welcome surprise. I ordered the chicago polish and I have to say it was one of the best I have had in the city to date, though 20 years of eating polish's won't dent the amount I have yet to try.  POLISH The polish came with a bevy of grilled onions draped over some mustard and small sport peppers(i hate when the sport peppers are so big that you have to attempt to bite them in half and end up making a big mess). The polish has a great casing that keeps the meat inside extra juicy and flavorful. It reminded of the dogs that Demon Dogs used to dish out under the fullerton L stop ~~RIP~~ The bun is nothing worth mentioning other than typical chicago dog-bun (AKA GREAT) Overall a great choice if your going to be pigging at Devil Dawgs.  My pops joined me on the adventure and went with the generic chicago dog that was "anything but generic." Quality meat, typical bun, and all the condiments you could ask for, nothing better. We both got "the meal" which is around 5 fat ones a piece. Includes a soda.... can or fountain, dog, and fries. And I let me tell you about dem fries. Soooooo good, greasy, salty, homemade, nothing more you could ask for. The grease is worth mentioning twice... amazing. Lets just say if your getting a dog get the fries, no joke. Very few downsides to this place... having said that here's why it doesn't deserve 5 stars. - No seats inside - Maybe room for 6-8 people to fit comfortably while ordering - The polish dog i ordered had already been grilled and was sitting on      the side of the grill-top. They grilled it some more to warm it up. I didn't mention it before because the taste of the polish justified what i saw when i was ordering - There are two picnic tables outside and i do not mean to be a crybaby but my dad and I had trouble telling each other how great the food was because of the train racing by overhead. THAT IS ALL This place reminds you why Chicago and especially Lincoln Park is the home to some of the best hot dogs in the world. You won't find any dolphin or duck in these dogs but what they lack in gourmet(and seats) they make up for in taste, service, and the traditional chicago way of eating Hot Dogs. Definitely going back as soon as possible to try the other dogs.  D E L I C I O U S

Just went today for the first time. Very nice staff. The food was solid, and the location is absolutely ideal for students and residents of Sheffield. Should become a late night classic very soon! Devil Dawgs will become part of my late night routine!

I love me a good hot dog. I also love not having to travel across the city for one, because you know sometimes at 3pm on a tuesday you just want some meat and a bun to take you through to dinner.... Alas, devil dawgs is here. They are located 2 doors down from my apartment which is pretty much as convenient as you can get. The dogs are delish, I've tried the polish, coney, and chicago dog - and echo what the others say about the mustard and onions on the coney - but so far the polish is my favorite... AND the FRIES are hand cut, and glorious - and I've already started craving them Their prices are reasonable, you can get out with a hot dog and fries for around $3.50 - $4.50 depending on what you order.  The people that work there are awesome too - friendly, kind, and all smiles. I got home at 1am last night and the place was packed - which made me happy to know they are open late :) cause you know sometimes i like to snack! haha Anyway, if you are in the area, hit it up - and you can bring a polish to me on your way to the el :)
Nice new addition to the neighborhood.  A simple menu that does Chicago proud.  Fresh cut fries a plus.  And footsteps from Depaul's campus.  Very affordable too.

they offer a coney dog, but they didn't put mustard or onions on it wtf?  that's just a chili dog.  I know they are brand new so i will cut them slack, but that shits not gunna fly next time.  I'm gunna watch these baboons like a hawk when they dress my wiener next time.
the people that work here are great. there so funny lol! Great Fries, home cut and they have Chicago red hots (very hard to find for some reason) yum yum!
